topic: Tuition Fees and Credit Transfer Concerns
question: I am currently facing the possibility of academic failure due to not having the required number of credits, and I am considering submitting an application for a prolongation to continue my studies. I have been accepted to transfer to another program but am concerned about the significant increase in tuition fees. I would like to know if there are options to keep paying the lower tuition fee or if there are scholarships or other support available. Additionally, I want to understand the process of transferring the credits I have already earned to this new program."
answer: If you switch programs, you will be required to pay the higher tuition fees. You can contact the general study advising for inquiries about waivers and scholarships. Information on transferring your credits can be found at https://www.cit.tum.de/en/cit/studies/students/examination-matters-modules/informatics/transfer-of-credits/.
